metadata.name: Requiem: Cloud #233
metadata.description:
<Requiem: Cloud> is a gen art project created by Jinyao Lin using p5js.

There are 103 color sets, 3 frame, 4 fragment and 2 dyeing types.

metadata.name: a formless beauty #26
metadata.description:
"a formless beauty" continues my exploration of pure abstract generative art. 

In this piece, I begin with a white field. An abstract pattern of rectangles are drawn on this field, using one of 12 different color palettes. On top of this, a white diamond or filled circle is drawn, and then marks (the term that IRL abstract painters will be familiar with) are drawn over the top of this. These three layers comprise the basis of the piece. 

Things are fairly deterministic so far, but this juncture, a large amount of randomness is introduced to the piece, as the image is passed through a fragment shader that applies fractal noise to the process, resulting in an image that appears to have been painted and then washed out. I would like to thank Melissa Wiederrecht for the inspiration in this regard; her Zbageti piece pushed me to explore shaders and their effect on the overall look of the piece. 

Note 1: Due to the nature of WebGL, this piece may not (probably will not) run in live mode on a mobile device. I've tested it on mobile Safari and mobile Chrome, and it will run sometimes, but the device is very unhappy with it. 

Note 2: Due to the nature of fractal noise and the preview engine in FxHash, the preview image will  be slightly different than the live view. It will give you a general idea of the piece, but the live view will be more vibrant and detailed.

Note 3: In Live view, press "s" to save a 4000x4000 PNG of the image to your system.

metadata.name: Quantum Folly #213
metadata.description:
This piece explores humanity's vanity and obsession with controlling natural forces. In the end we are beholden to the whims of the universe and its rules. What we think is artificial is but nature's inclination.

As an atom gazes at the world it can see the arrogant hand of mankind imposing its will. We are nature's inane creation built from imperceptible, discrete particles.

Enjoy watching the structures form. Due to the nature of the system it may take some time to complete. Once it's fully rendered you can download a full resolution image of 3508 x 4961 px by ***double clicking/tapping***. At this size the piece is printable at A3 size at 300 dpi. If you're interested in acquiring a signed print please contact @KRANKARTA.

Features include: palette, orientation, architecture, particle rules, boundary seepage and colour displacement.

Created on Chrome desktop 103.0 on 2022-07-21 in javascript and GLSL. Results on other browsers/devices may vary.

metadata.name: TEST01 #137
metadata.description: Feature is possession

metadata.name: Fire Card #139
metadata.description:
Fire Cards is a series of generative artworks inspired by 19th-century Japanese fireworks catalogues. The images in these catalogues didn't so much focus on realism, but on the visual associations of the pyrotechnic effects instead. Using a restricted color palette and relatively simple shapes, this resulted in vibrant, graphical posters that sparked your own imagination more than anything else.

In Fire Cards, the abstract, static images are transformed back into lively, dynamic worlds again, each with their own distinctive, centuries-old aesthetics. Using a custom animation and 2D render system, the algorithmically generated worlds slowly build up and show a magical fireworks performance.

Fire Cards are tiny, personal and unique shows of wonder.

metadata.name: a fleeting moment #229
metadata.description:
Abstract expressionism always has been, and always will be, my first love. With this piece, the initial premise was "can I write a bit of code that will render images in the style that I actually paint in real life?" 

It took several full days of poking and prodding, and I departed from the original mission once I had what I was looking for, but in general, I think I succeeded. My wife was looking over my shoulder at one point, and thought I was looking at a scan of one of my actual paintings, which sounds like success to me. 

Created with love in p5.js

metadata.name: a manifested realization #4
metadata.description:
In general, this piece continues my study of procedural abstract expressionism. However, I've developed a new small bit of code I am testing here; I am trying to create a "clumping" noise function that looks natural but doesn't have the obvious "look" of Perlin noise, and is more controllable. This piece contains my first public use of this. So it is, in a way, a test. 

I was inspired by the IRL paintings of Francesco D'Adamo, specifically his "Manifesti" series, although (as is the way of things) the end result looks nothing like what I started with, and is a more general 1950s abstract expressionism look. 

This piece is a gift to the collectors of all my recent "a" mints. Thank you all!

metadata.name: Movimento #122
metadata.description:
"No matter who you are, how many will accompany you, you always go somewhere even if that place is staying here. You move!" - Grandmaster of the storm

Press the [S] to save 2048x2048 png

This artwork was created with p5.js

Collab: Nobody (@jorgemauro1000) and Eduxdux (@eduxdux_).

metadata.name: PLANET ERROR #113
metadata.description:
The legendary collaboration between ippsketch and Piter Pasma.

Option: Put a hash with a number like #2 or #3 after the URL to render at double or triple the resolution!

metadata.name: Los Osos 2422 #1731
metadata.description:
# Los Osos 2422

I was working on the next EmProps release when accidentally I opened a link to a bear utopic civilization through their existing metaverse. Or should I say "metabears"?

Enter Los Osos 2422. 

Four hundred years into the future bears live in a peaceful civilization heavily inspired by the generative art movement of our times. They are organized in districts that are sustained by bamboo, salmon, berries, and art! Los Osos are black, grizzly, panda, and polar, yet there are no distinctions between species; it's not like they were humans. 

They have different occupations but frequently bears change jobs giving birth to the most eclectic looks.

I took my sketchbook out to capture what I could and started drawing but my presence pissed them off. Ninjas, luchadores, and even a cybearpunk forced me to escape.  Is that a live gummy bear or am I just hungry? The story will continue...

-- 

Los Osos 2422 is a PFP art piece composed of 320 hand-made drawings made as an homage to the nascent generative art current fueled by Tezos blockchain technology in 2022. It features hundreds of references to artists and pieces in several generative and non-generative fields.

The project combines the assets together using a custom open-source algorithm that allows them to stack with the positioning in front and behind the character to create possibilities like shirt collars or hats, dynamic tinting to have hoodies or glasses with different colors, exceptions to give them laser eyes or a green apple in front of the face, complex set-ups to have different versions for some of the outfits, and chance control to allow precise control over the features.

--

Press 'S' on the keyboard to save it as an 1800 x 1800 pixels PNG.

metadata.name: One Eleven (are Better Than Thirty) #104
metadata.description:
One Eleven (are Better Than Thirty), is the fourth installment of One Eleven, a periodical experiment.

Even though Andy Warhols work is not cc0, the Mona Lisa is. So yes, this is inspired, heavily, by Andy Warhol, most notably the piece Thirty are Better Than One, but uses no component of it. Let‚Äôs call it an homage. We also feel that if Andy were alive today, they would embrace cc0. Art is just about fame and exposure anyways, right?

And yes, initially we wanted to make a grid that had exactly 111 Mona Lisas on it, but tbh, it looked terrible. They were too small, and the iterations were too same-y. So, instead, each iteration of this will have 111 pages, each with varying amounts of Mona Lisas. You just click the art and a new page appears. 111 for each one minted. Then it loops back around.

So, really, this collection gives you 111 pieces for the price of 1, which is free. Pretty good deal.

How do you get on the list? Read below:

Collectors of the genesis One Eleven (#12743) are on the allow list for all One Eleven collections, this one included. A bit before minting is enabled, the list will be updated granting one reserve for each iteration held. So, buy one before this drops. Any procured after the scheduled release time will not get you on the list, but will be considered once the reserves are lifted. Reserves will be lifted after 111 hours, give or take.

As a bonus, whoever holds One Eleven #1 will receive #1 of this collection as an airdrop. The project will be disabled until that happens, but should occur right around the scheduled time.

Half of the royalties for all One Eleven collections will be shared with the minter.

This collection uses the One Eleven SDK, which makes embedding One Eleven into FXHash collections very simple. You can use it if you like for your projects, as it is cc0. Talk to us on twitter if you'd like to release it as a collab.

More info: an0n.wtf/sdk

I'm sorry this is so complicated. When it started, it seemed simpler.

metadata.name: The Living Book #1 #39
metadata.description:
I have been exploring the medium of print for years. Mixing etching, silk-screening, offset, photocopy, risography, drawing and painting to design and craft experimental art books.From the day digital, which had always fascinated me, took over my publishing practice, I always liked to create bridges between these two worlds.

The Living Books is part of this series of hybrid and experimental works where paper and digital resonate.

This issue #1 is made of 64 pages that will be minted by collectors. A book will eventually be printed and the pages will follow the mint order. Each page exists in a cover version (c) and a xerox version (x).

Controls :

‚Ä¢ Click to dive into each frame.
‚Ä¢ Press C to toggle cover mode.
‚Ä¢ Press X to toggle xerox mode.
‚Ä¢ Press 1, 2, 3, or 4 to make a capture and download a PNG with a resolution of x1, x2, x3 or x4.

‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî

The Living Book #1 by Ferdinand Dervieux, 2022
Made with Unity
License: CC BY-NC-SA 4.0

metadata.name: Morphing Convictions #19
metadata.description:
Everyday we move on by relying on our convictions. Their immutability often helps us take decisions or take shelter but can sometimes clash with the unknown, the different and the new. They can then crack, crumble and mutate. To change your convictions means changing the kind of person you want to be. It means changing your self-identity. And that is not just hard, it is scary. And beautiful.

Morphing Convictions is a piece that exists through two kind of outputs : Posters and Scenes. Posters are focusing on the contemplation of details and movements of a morphing conviction while the Scenes are interactive little worlds where you can explore a conviction in it's environment.

Please open in live mode to enjoy a much better experience.

Controls :

Posters & Scenes
‚Ä¢ Click anywhere to enable audio.
‚Ä¢ Press M to toggle mute.
‚Ä¢ Press F to toggle the fullscreen mode.
‚Ä¢ Press 1, 2, 3, or 4 to make a capture and download a PNG with a resolution of x1, x2, x3 or x4.

Scenes only
‚Ä¢ Drag and scroll to rotate and zoom.
‚Ä¢ Click on objects, some might react.

‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî

Morphing Convictions by Ferdinand Dervieux, 2022
Made with Unity
License: CC BY-NC-SA 4.0

metadata.name: Los Osos 2422 #749
metadata.description:
# Los Osos 2422

I was working on the next EmProps release when accidentally I opened a link to a bear utopic civilization through their existing metaverse. Or should I say "metabears"?

Enter Los Osos 2422. 

Four hundred years into the future bears live in a peaceful civilization heavily inspired by the generative art movement of our times. They are organized in districts that are sustained by bamboo, salmon, berries, and art! Los Osos are black, grizzly, panda, and polar, yet there are no distinctions between species; it's not like they were humans. 

They have different occupations but frequently bears change jobs giving birth to the most eclectic looks.

I took my sketchbook out to capture what I could and started drawing but my presence pissed them off. Ninjas, luchadores, and even a cybearpunk forced me to escape.  Is that a live gummy bear or am I just hungry? The story will continue...

--

metadata.name: Abstract Life #186
metadata.description:
The concept of organic, obtained from living systems, is said to be an effect that, like a plant and a living being, has grown in a completely dynamic manner in different degrees, and no factor except vital forces has prevented its growth. Organic creation is an example of this type. L√©onard de Vinci believed in nature; he wrote, "Painting is a child of nature" in his opinion, art should be compatible with nature. His public image of creativity was "innovation while maintaining fidelity" to nature. According to Michelangelo, the form the artist gives to the materials is in the artist's mind and the materials themselves. Therefore, the artist is always in a metaphysical struggle with the form and secrets of nature. This is a revelatory process through which the artist discovers the mass of paper already hidden in his mind and the materials. As an architect, I tried to create this work while paying attention to the structuralism of shapes and forms in creation, inspired by the colors in nature and my experience in painting and illustration.

To spread the vibe of my beautiful community, minters will own 50% of royalty on each secondary sale.
Eighteen different color palettes and three different borders are used in this artwork.
Made in p5js
Created August 2022
Artist: @ChistaAi

metadata.name: WILTED #2
metadata.description:
There is beauty even in WILTED flowers.

Shape the petals of your WILTED flower with the bezier curves of your liking, and in the colour that strikes you most. I guarantee that you will find it. Let your tastes, simplistic or busy, exhibit themselves in the pattern you choose. You will find your perfect match within these imperfect flowers.

Made with P5.js.

metadata.name: –ü—Ä–∏—Ç—è–∂–µ–Ω–∏–µ #159
metadata.description:
Inspired by Kazimir Malevich works, ‚Äú–ü—Ä–∏—Ç—è–∂–µ–Ω–∏–µ‚Äù features the connection between shapes, their positions and colours.
Although, as the work tries to develop further into a non-objective world, some real sceneries can still be associated with it.

‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî

Rendering takes around 20 seconds at 60 fps, might take longer on older devices.
Press [1‚Ä¶6] to change an image resolution up to 10k.
Press [S] after the image is rendered to save it.

Created using p5.js.
License: CC BY-NC-SA 4.0.

hrunz. ‚Äî Aug. 2022.
